ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would recommend it to both Japan specialists and those with a general interest in film. I would caution undergrads that the class was half graduate students and sometimes the conversation seemed pitched at the grads, based on supplementary readings they had in Japanese, which left most of the undergrads out. It's therefore helpful to have some Japanese background to get the most out of this class.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: Since I come from a literary studies background, there was a lot of valuable foundational information. I felt like I became comfortable with the basic conversations about Japanese film (at least before 1960), and I'm also glad for the perspectives I gained on ways to think about mass culture and cultural discourse.
